question:
NITI Aayog recently launched the AIM’s Atal Community Innovation Centre. Consider the following statements:
  1. The scheme will set up community centres at tribal, backward and remote districts of India.
  2. It will be 100% funded by Centre and state governments.
  3. Atal Innovation Mission also focuses on improving entrepreneurship in India.
Which of the above statements are correct? Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The scheme will aim to set up community centres for innovation in the tier II and III cities, unserved areas, backward, tribal and also remote areas. At its launch, the need to use local resources to meet energy demands was highlighted to be a desired outcome of this infrastructure. The centres will have access to current technology and will seek to become “incubatees for innovation”. Statement 2 is incorrect: The project is to be funded on a public- private partnership model or will be funded by PSUs. The fund will be sourced from the Corporate Social Responsibility funds of the firms. The Atal Innovation Mission will lend a grant-in-aid for these centres, limited to 2.5 crore INR. This grant is subject to suitable fulfilment of the criteria set by ACIC and also similar contribution from the funding partners. Statement 3 is correct: The AIM was launched with the aim of boosting innovation and entrepreneurship in the country. It seeks to support entrepreneurship in India by promoting “self-employment and talent utilisation”. It has a number of initiatives for these objectives: Atal Tinkering Labs at school levels, Atal Incubators at university and industry levels, Atal New India Challenge, Atal Grand Challenge, etc.
